definition: the military revolt of 960 that led Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 to found the Song dynasty
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
bridge/CL:座[zuo4]

to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
Zhao Kuangyin, personal name of founding Song emperor Song Taizu 宋太祖 (927-976)
lit. to take the yellow gown (idiom)/fig. to be made emperor/to take the crown
Emperor Taizu of Song, posthumous title of the founding Song emperor Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 (927-976), reigned from 960
to dismiss military hierarchy using wine cups/cf Song founding Emperor Song Taizu 宋太祖 holds a banquet in 961 and persuades his senior army commanders to go home to their provinces
Xuanwu gate coup of June 626 in early Tang, in which Li Shimin 李世民 killed his brothers, seized the throne from his father as Emperor Taizong 唐太宗
war of 1402 between successors of the first Ming Emperor

Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]
Later Zhou of the Five Dynasties (951-960), centered on Shandong and Hebei, with capital at Kaifeng 开封
Later Jin of the Five Dynasties (936-946)
Huang Chao peasant uprising 875-884 in late Tang, led by Huang Chao
Later Tang of the Five Dynasties (923-936)
Later Han or Eastern Han dynasty (25-220)/Later Han of the Five Dynasties (947-950)
Tang of the Five Southern Dynasties 937-975
Great Ancestor (posthumous title, e.g. for the founder of a dynasty)
Emperor Zhaozong of Tang, reign name of twentieth Tang emperor 李曄|李晔[Li1 Ye4] (867-904), reigned 888-904
Han of the Five dynasties (951-979), one of ten kingdoms during the Five Dynasties, Ten Kingdoms period (907-960)
